Authors:
Diana S. Marasinghe, Milan C. Samarakoon, Sinang Hongsanan,
Saranyaphat Boonmee, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Iodosphaeria honghense sp. nov. (Iodosphaeriaceae,
Xylariomycetidae) from Yunnan province, China
Abstract:
A new Iodosphaeria honghense was collected from dead twigs
of unknown host in Honghe, Yunnan province, China. This study introduces
Iodosphaeria honghense based on morphological characteristics and
phylogenetic analyses. Iodosphaeria honghensis has cylindrical to
allantoid, non-mucilaginous and guttulate ascospores which are
distinguished from other similar taxa. Multigene phylogenies based on
LSU, ITS and RPB2 sequence data generated from maximum likelihood and
MrBayes analyses indicate that I. honghensis forms a distinct lineage
within Iodosphaeriaceae. This study provides its detailed illustration
with a morphological comparison of accepted Iodosphaeria species using a
key.
